page.title: 03FORESTRY IN LOCHALSH
page.content: Well over half the number of trees planted in our area are Sitka spruce. Larch,pine and Norway spruce are also planted.Broadleaved trees are not planted on any great scale because they do not grow as quickly as conifers.The climate is more suited to conifers.These conifers are cut down when they are 40 to 50 years old.The logs are sent to Fort William and the small pieces of wood go for fire wood. When the trees are felled the land is replanted with trees again.There are over twenty people employed in the forest.They work on felling, planting, weeding and fencing. Some are employed on wildlife control. There are two foresters.They have the job of organising the work for the men and then checking that it is done properly.
